name: Lenovo Core i5 7th Gen - (8 GB/1 TB HDD/DOS/2 GB Graphics) IP 320E Laptop
content:
Wanted to give something over 4 but don't have that option.
First of all, the price point at which I got this laptop (37k), it's a deal breaker kind of laptop.
You will get everything what is mentioned there on description but you must install all the drivers from lenovo website related to this product, because I have seen people writing about 2hr battery life and very low sound etc. and all that could be because of improper drivers on their device. I am giving my review after using it for 4 days almost 8-9 hrs daily and that is enough for me to judge as I have used 3 laptops before it.
Features:
With all proper drivers installed:
1.) Good clock speed and it really works fast. (2.5 GHz, turbo boost upto 3.1 GHz)
2.) Decent battery backup on moderate use (3.5 hrs on average from 100% to 15%)
3.) Works very good with windows 10 pro and all the features are well placed by lenovo on this machine.

Overall it's a very good product for business purpose and Data analysis task and some much heavier task too. With NVIDIA DDR5 dedicated graphics, you can easily play all recent games but do remember to play them on charging mode.

Cons:
1.) Only 2 USB 3.0 slot and no VGA output slot (HDMI only), the right side of laptop should have been utilized with at least one more USB 3.0 slot and VGA output slot.
2.) Although sound is not bad but its pretty weak on the loudness part as compared to my previous Dell model with same Dolby audio feature.
3.) and last, Flipkart must check with its Seller that why there is some issue in warranty status. I also got 10 days less warranty when I registered my device on Lenovo support centre. READ MORE

name: Lenovo Core i5 7th Gen - (8 GB/1 TB HDD/DOS/2 GB Graphics) IP 320E Laptop
review title: Everything you need to know about the Laptop
content:
I have bought this laptop for price of 39,990 and been using it for a day. Following are my initial impressions.

The design is quite simple and elegant, With not much decorations on the laptop and a plain design. The speaker placement might muffle the sound if not placed properly. The ports placement is decent enough for a comfortable use.

The package contains the laptop and the charger with a few booklets and I didn't find a warranty Card with it. Anyhow the charger looks good but the length of the wire could be a problem as it is not that long. But it does the work if a charging point Is at a decent distance


Processor- i5 7th gen
Graphics-2 Giga Byte Nvidia Geforce 940mx + intel HD 620 Graphics
Ram- 8 Giga Bytes DDR4 (but distributed in both slots 4GB each)

Powered by a 2 cell battery which lasted about 3 Hours 30 Min on first charge, So i believe Battery won't last that long in this laptop.

There's minor heat up near the mouse track pad while charging or slight heavy usage. Haven't installed games yet, But expect a little heating while Gaming too.

Its not a Led Back lit Keyboard, but wide enough and quite comfortable to use.
The Mouse track pad does not support Multi Touch and is not that comfortable to use(may vary for different users) but it does the work quite smoothly.

The screen is not a Full HD screen, But its decent indoors and the viewing angles are Fine too. But Don't expect a lot from the screen.

Speaker placement is at the bottom of the laptop, And is said to be a Dolby Speakers. Yet the sound is not loud enough. But the quality of the sound is crisp and clear and would do the work for you if you are a earphone/headphone person.

I would be updating the review after a short amount of time and using this laptop as a regular choice of mine. Meanwhile ask any queries that you might have before the purchase.

Also do checkout the 8th gen laptops that have started launching and if you can wait for a while, Better switch to a 8th gen laptop.

But if the 8th gen does not peak your interest and you want reliable laptop. go ahead and give this laptop a try. READ MORE

name: Lenovo Core i5 7th Gen - (8 GB/1 TB HDD/DOS/2 GB Graphics) IP 320E Laptop
content:
hello everyone, I am going to rate Lenovo Ideapad 320E after 2 days usage so let's begin:-
*product is awesome in both looks & feel and performance aspect it's metallic finish really provide it a premium look.
*it is integrated with DOS so basically you yourself have to install windows OS in it. But one thing you have to keep in mind is that the intel core i5 7002u is a Kaby Lake processor and that is why the laptop will only support windows 10 64-bit (UEFI boot mode recommended). otherwise you will face many other problems that you won't be able to notice the cause of.
*I chose this laptop because of it's ground breaking specifications and Nvidea GeForce 940mx which really Is a powerful processor (I have played watch dogs 2 and GTA V at good graphic settings without noticing any leg or frame drops)
*sound output is good although dolby option in settings is a plus point for some peoples but I don't like that option that much(frankly speaking).
*screen is pretty descent enough and also colour reproduction, Brightness, & saturation is good too.
SOME THINGS I DON'T LIKE ABOUT THIS MACHINE:-
*only two USB ports are provided but the good thing is both are 3.0
*battery backup is a bit lower according to my liking Lenovo should have provided a bigger battery because it has to handle a powerful GPU too.
*cooling fan is on the bottom of this laptop and that is why you have to use the laptop on a flat surface and you will not be able to use the laptop while putting it in bad or any kind of spongy surface which can mask the fan for a very long time. But don't bother about that because most of the laptops are coming with the same fitting of fan and that is why it's not a big issue.
QUESTIONS I AM PRETTY EXCITED TO ANSWER:-
*some peoples are saying that the mousepad is not working out of the box and cursor is not moving?
well I have already told you that it is a kaby lake processor and will only accept win 10 64- bit and boot in UEFI mode you will not face this kind of issue for sure and if you does than time to replace your product because it is definitely a faulty one.
*Laptop is making noise like kurrrrrr?
Mine is not, so I will not say anything about this issue.
Friends, the thing is you simply install win 10 64-bit and you will not face any issues, Or if you don't wanna go through all the pain than simply buy the windows variant of this laptop which is available at the price of 45,990/- and if you have 4000 bucks extra to spend than you should definitely buy the windows variant.
Thank you for reading my opinion and also for reading it till the last.. READ MORE

name: Lenovo Core i5 7th Gen - (8 GB/1 TB HDD/DOS/2 GB Graphics) IP 320E Laptop
review title: Lenovo delivered a performance bomb in this price segment.
content:
One of the best in this price segments. I have been using it for past 1 month and my review and ratings are based on the my usage( which is quite heavy). Lenovo could have provided Back-lit keyboard since it's completely unusable at night. Talking about the performance, I'm completely happy with my purchase as it sufficient to handle every heavy support and games. Speakers isn't that loud though.
I have been using Adobe Primere Pro and Photoshop without any lag. But I still can't figure out the disk usage soaring to 100% if multiple software like this opened in the background. This never happens with my desktop with Rygen 3 processor Radeon RX560 and 8 GB of RAMs. Well it's not that big issue since I'm not going to use these type of heavy apps everyday and simultaneously. When I purchased it I'm little bit confused of it's dedicated GPU performance i.e GeForce 940MX. I have to reduce the settings to med-low in some of the recent titles. I'll tell you some of the major games which can be played at above 30-35fps
Call of duty series
Battlefield series. You'll have to reduce the settings to low for the upcoming battlefield 1
Far cry series
Fallout series
Need for speed series
Forza series
Splinter cell series
Batman Arkham series
Crysis series
GTA series
It can run many games. Personally, I think that most graphically demanding games up to late 2015 can be run by it at reasonable settings. From late 2015 it may run some games mostly at med-low or low settings, but not all - and may pretty much struggle when running these that it can.
Keyboard in this laptop is top notch, but I'm little bit disappointed with trackpad it's not that responsive.
Battery life in this device is quite good(not the best I would say since I have a surface 4 with me that has a magnificent battery life). It can deliver 4-5 hours of battery life but if you work with battery saver on then it can go past 7 hrs mark easily.
Overall a recommended product. READ MORE

name: Lenovo Core i5 7th Gen - (8 GB/1 TB HDD/DOS/2 GB Graphics) IP 320E Laptop
content:
I used the laptop for a week and here is it am finally ready with my honest review perfectly analysed :

-The lappy comes with a DOS and you need to install Windows 10 (64 Bit) as the drivers are not supported for any other OS. Be sure about what operating system you are planning to install.

- The drivers can be found in the Lenovo Official site where you need to find your lappy (use serial no for better experience) and then download all and install them one by one.

- I have read a lot of reviews hearing complaints about its graphics and display ,but trust me it's cluelessly fine .You just need to install both the Intel and NVIDIA graphics driver for the best viewing experience.

- Same goes for the trackpad , majority of them complains about this but it's also fine . Just install the synaptics driver for best performance.

- People do complain about some "kur-kur" sound from the hard disk . But honestly speaking there is nothing such.

- The sound is comparatively a little less because the speakers are downwardly placed. But the Dolby digital sound experience is awesome too.Sound output via headphones are just more than fine

Concluding the fact it's the best laptop you can get at this price. Thanks to big billion day I got it for 35k .The laptop was also delivered on time and came properly packed.
Hope this review will help a lot of you who have already ordered this and is also planning to get one.
Thank you. READ MORE

name: Lenovo Core i5 7th Gen - (8 GB/1 TB HDD/DOS/2 GB Graphics) IP 320E Laptop
content:
Product was excellently packed, thanks to Flipkart for that. Coming to product.... it has DOS System. Can be installed any OS. Before installing Windows 10, change the BIOS Settings to UEFI first. They kept default as Legacy. After installing Windows in UEFI mode you will not see the classic blue boot logo of Windows 10, it will be replaced by Lenovo logo. But thats normal, no need to worry.

You can use SSD for getting maximum juice of it. Boot time will be reduced to 8 secs!

There's another glitch in Windows installation.... the keyboard switch of display brightness will stop working! It's not hardware related, it's a known problem for windows. There's no solution for this bug till now. I have installed dual boot with Linux. It works well with Linux. So hardware is okay.

Not much fan of playing games. Excellent in Norma work. Very fast and smooth.Will write after few days again. It's just one day..... READ MORE

name: Lenovo Core i5 7th Gen - (8 GB/1 TB HDD/DOS/2 GB Graphics) IP 320E Laptop
content:
This really is the best laptop that you will get in this price range. I have ordered this on 9th Sept and received the product on 10th Sept. Really super quick delivery from Flipkart. I won't discuss about the configuration and hardware as it is already mentioned in the specifications of the product. So now, let's go into my first impressions of the product.

The overall look of the product is nice. It feels nice on the top with smooth black finish and lenovo branding on it. The keyboard is Alphanumeric, but the only bummer is that the and arrow keys are integrated into one key's space. The mouse keys are integrated into the touchpad because of which the touchpad doesn't feel like it is sturdy enough. There are no air vents on the sides. They are located just below the screen near the link between the lower and upper parts of laptop and the other under the laptop. I have installed dual OS, Windows 10 and Ubuntu 16.0.4. But I didn't feel any heat dissipating from the laptop while installation. Everyone is raising concerns about sound output from speakers and some sound coming out from hard drive. But I don't have faced any such issues. There is no sound coming from my hard drive. The sound output is not very less and also not too high. It is moderate and audible enough if you keep your laptop on flat surface and not on bed. One interesting feature is that the screen opens up upto 180 , a feature that none of it's competitors have. The battery is non-removable and battery life is nearly 4-5 hrs with wifi turned on and moderate internet usage.

So overall, the product is decent enough and really a bang for your buck. If you are in market looking for a laptop with decent looks and good performance I would definitely recommend this. I will update about the pros and cons of the product once I test it for 3-4 weeks.

Please do like if you loved my first impressions on the product and wait till my next update with my comprehensive review about the product. READ MORE

name: Lenovo Core i5 7th Gen - (8 GB/1 TB HDD/DOS/2 GB Graphics) IP 320E Laptop
content:
Good value for the every penny you spend on this Model. Purchased this laptop on sale and got it for 38k with Windows 10 pre-installed, which is a pretty good deal. After playing with a week writing this review. This is the best buy for school/college related works and little gaming. I'm not a big fan of high end games so can't comment seriously about the graphic processor's performance. But considering Nvidia 940mx 2GB DDR5, i hope its capable enough to play games with low to medium settings. Regarding the processor, yes its i5-7200U which is a kabylake segment and I could able to see its turbo boosting to 3.1GHz quite often but the 5400RPM 1TB HDD is quite slow to load some programs. But considering the price we can't expect more than this. It has 8GB of RAM and while checking in Task Manager seems both the slots are occupied and I'm assuming its 2x4GB are there. Windows start up is quite fast for this segment. All drivers are preinstalled already and comes with 1 year Mcafee live safe preinstalled. One point to mention here is whole 1TB is dedicated to C drive. Regarding charger, Yes its quite handy, but length of the wire is not too long but manageable, It charges quite fast like in 2 hrs and battery backup when doing light work you can expect upto 3.30 to 4 hrs and with battery saving turned on, it should be above 4 to 5 hrs. Lenovo website is quite handy for updating the drivers, Let the laptop auto detect itself on their site and you will get notification for Driver updates. Yesterday I received BIOS update and I really like the way its designed. You won't be receiving any DVD/CD along with the package but you can get the recovery media from the Lenovo site by placing the order since this particular variant is eligible to get one. Please note, you can order ONLY ONCE and you should keep your recovery media USB safe. After ordering, you get a link from where you have to download Lenovo recovery tool which validates your order and automatically downloads the required recovery media and it'll let you copy the same in USB(16GB recommended). I liked this recovery media support from Lenovo and I give thumps up for this. Coming to the audio performance, its not that loud but audio is crisp and clear. I recommend using Head phones. Webcam is good for this price.

Why I bought this laptop?
1. Needed i5 7th Gen within 40k range
2. In future replacing the internal HDD with SSD one will increase the performance like 60 to 70%
3. Since 2 slots are there, RAM is upgradable to 16GB in future if needed..Yes DDR4 indeed

Please note: There is a little noise from HDD but its not such a big issue since mechanical parts are involved, even my old laptop gave me similar noise. When the deal is good for future you can compromise here and there. READ MORE

name: Lenovo Core i5 7th Gen - (8 GB/1 TB HDD/DOS/2 GB Graphics) IP 320E Laptop
content:
This one is a perfect laptop and a no-brainer who has an entry level budget around 40K and wants to be able to do "everything" that you can with a 100K+ laptop. (Obviously not 120fps 1080p gaming for latest games but yeah still do-able at lower quality). Remember, this one comes with dedicated GDDR5 memory. All other laptops under 50K will only give you DDR3 memory for graphic card. This makes a HUGE difference for graphics applications including games. GDDR5 is way wayy more faster than DDR3 in terms of performance.

With a Flipkart Deal this laptop cost me 36K, No Cost EMI and made the perfect gift to my sister who absolutely loves this. She does play a few games and likes how this laptop can very smoothly handle them (Euro Truck Sim, Battlefield 3). There is no other laptop that I know of which can do this under 50K. Even at its listing price of 42K it makes absolute sense in that budget (and in fact even up to 55K there's no competition).

The hard disk is the only bottle-neck in this laptop. Just wait for warranty to expire and plonk in a SSD and you will have a beast of a laptop. Or plonk it in anyway if you dont care about warranty. Shame, this should have come with a configurable SSD option and this would have brought all competition to its knees. There's no mSATA port either for SSD add-on so the only option is to replace your HDD or opt for Caddy drive sacrificing the DVD drive. READ MORE

name: Lenovo Core i5 7th Gen - (8 GB/1 TB HDD/DOS/2 GB Graphics) IP 320E Laptop
content:
Prompt delivery from Flipkart even during the hectic rush of the Big Billion Days sale. Coming to the laptop here goes my review:

Pros:
1. Relatively lightweight thanks to some clever component placement.
2. Moderate heating up when executing processor intensive programs.
3. Goodness of Dolby Atmos enhancement means decent audio levels from the on-board speakers and excellent audio with headphones.
4. 7th Gen i5 is good enough and paired with 8 gigs of RAM for effortless multitasking.
5. Dedicated GPU for graphics intensive programs while the on-board Intel HD takes care of mundane display handling tasks. It is able to handle most games with ease at medium graphics settings.
6. Decent speed from the wireless features, be it Bluetooth or WiFi.

Cons:
1. Display: Gets the job done but not the best in class and it's just HD LED so don't expect to be blown away.
2. Battery backup is ok for mundane use, about 3-4 hours, but if you are into intensive usage then it's going to be a race between you and the poor battery.
3. Absence of a side mounted exhaust means you are limited to using fan based cooling pads and cannot use the vacuum cooling pods. READ MORE

name: Lenovo Core i5 7th Gen - (8 GB/1 TB HDD/DOS/2 GB Graphics) IP 320E Laptop
review title: good laptop configuration stylish design affordable price
content:
I purchased this on the billion day sale on 24th sept in exchange for my old hp pavilion g6- 1201tx got it on 3rd October.

The screen is good and I do not see any reflection on the screen , this is because of the anti glare display and the colors are also good for me.
I had to install the win 10 from a usb 3.0 using unetbootin software and win 10 iso file , be prepared to press lots of tabs and spacebar and use shift + f10 to do right click as the touchpad driver will not start till you install the driver- had to remove the url but go to lenovo site and search for 320 15IKB 80x or 80Y Be ready with the drivers beforehand is my advice.
I do not play many games but downloaded this sniper game from the app store the graphics look stunning.
The keyboard feels nice to type they are little bit apart so no mistake in typing by unintended presses of nearby keys.
The charger looks more like a bigger brother of a mobile charger and the wire is thin but good enough length- I would be careful of accidently putting wire below chair leg or something.
I looked at many youtube reviews of the laptop before purchasing this one and I can say it looks even better and also the build quality feels like metal only instead of the abs body this is made of, is very light weight too.
For people going for Linux install beware that the touchpad driver are not there for Linux distros and the workaround in websites make the wifi faulty
If you need to install Linux just wait for the Ubuntu community to release some kind of fix before installing it.
I registered for the warranty however I did not find how to do redemptions for the adp specified at the top guess I will call Lenovo customer care and find out, same for the macaffe free subscription.
Battery life will not be as good because it has only 2cell battery - but I am always near a power plug so no issues for me.
For outdoor laptop users this could be a problem.
I checked for warrenty extension and it seems we have to pay 4199 for 2 year carry in warrenty extension.
I will check that when maybe Lenovo is giving some offer in laptops warrenty extension as you can purchase extra warranty till your original one does not expire.
Will update this thread after a month or so for other buyers to make informed descisions.

If you guys want to wait a little i5 8th gen laptops will be coming later this year also I saw one- laptop Acer A515-A51G which has the successor of 940mx i.e. MX150 which has better performance and you can play even better games with that one also it has a 4 cell battery too so longer time without charger.
But if you are a casual gamer and just want to use the laptop for some gaming and more watching movies this one does the job and also high end games in lowest settings. READ MORE

name: Lenovo Core i5 7th Gen - (8 GB/1 TB HDD/DOS/2 GB Graphics) IP 320E Laptop
review title: Brilliant value for money - a must buy.
content:
Works as advertised. Once you remove some of the bloatware, this is easily the best piece of hardware this side of the 40K mark. A 7th Gen i5, with 8GB RAM is unheard of in this segment. The screen is not Full HD, so that can be a bummer, but it's doable for the price you pay - especially since it comes with a 2GB Nvidia Graphic Card which should be good enough for most games on low settings. The build quality is also pretty decent for the price, and even though there is a little flex when you press down hard on the keyboard section, it feels sturdy enough as a whole. Again - this is no unibody Aluminum build - so expecting that kind of quality at this rate is unrealistic.

Overall, a build totally worth it.

P.S. - Make sure you check the warranty date, cause mine was already active a month before I got delivery (only got 11 months remaining on warranty) - so I had to contact Lenovo Customer Support. Still waiting a callback from them as of the day I'm writing this review. Also - you can buy extended warranty for about 4.5K for 2 more years from the official Lenovo website and it can be applied anytime at least 15 days before the original 1 Year warranty expires. READ MORE

name: Lenovo Core i5 7th Gen - (8 GB/1 TB HDD/DOS/2 GB Graphics) IP 320E Laptop
review title: Awesome Laptop but could be better in after sale service
content:
Awesome Laptop no doubt. With awesome specification aligned, it works well.
I have faced an issue with this laptop during initial stage, with battery getting exhausted rapidly and overheating, but it wasn't a laptop issue maybe it was some viruse issue, and then i formatted the entire laptop it started working well.
Battery backup came to its normal stage of approximately 4-5 hrs, as well as there is no heating issue anymore. But during those period, i realized that lenovo after sale service is not up to mark, where i have an onsite warranty with my laptop i asked the customer care team to arrange an engineer visit to my home, but these team were virtually taking access of my laptop and telling me your laptop is fine but it was not, they didn't arrange any engineer visit, where i felt it's not right. But somehow after formatting laptop it started working well.
I would say if sombody who's very much concerned about after sales service, have to consider this. Therefor i have given 4 stars. READ MORE
